title: [feature request] consistent default values for leaky_relu
body_html:
Working with leaky ReLU I found out that the default value for negative_slope is different if you use nn.LeakyReLU (default is 0.02) or nn.functional.leaky_relu (default is 0.01).

Is it okay to ask to set the default negative_slope to the same value in both places?

Thanks!
body_text:
Working with leaky ReLU I found out that the default value for negative_slope is different if you use nn.LeakyReLU (default is 0.02) or nn.functional.leaky_relu (default is 0.01).
Is it okay to ask to set the default negative_slope to the same value in both places?
Thanks!
body:
Working with leaky ReLU I found out that the default value for `negative_slope` is different if you use `nn.LeakyReLU` (default is [0.02][1]) or `nn.functional.leaky_relu` (default is [0.01][2]).

Is it okay to ask to set the default `negative_slope` to the same value in both places?

Thanks!

 [1]: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/modules/activation.py#L504
 [2]: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/functional.py#
